item.title: Project: REPLAY
item.description:
####

####REPLAY A desktop action game where you need to escape deadly clones that are following your exact path.

####Contribution Although I have joined the team 2,5 months before the release, I was honored to become “tools lead” and have contributed to various aspects of the development:

  • Designed and added “New Game+” (except intercom mixing)
  • Developed Messaging and Subtitles systems
  • Integrated encrypted save files, including user statistics
  • Worked on Interactibles and Player Controller
  • Was in charge of Windows builds, developed a Demo build option
  • Reintroduced shadows, worked on optimizations
  • Minor script/scene fixes
  • Active team discussion participation

####Trailer

####Purpose of Creation UCSC G+PM Masters thesis.

####Release & Demo http://earlgreygames.com/replay

item.title: Project: CppnSword
item.description:
####

####CppnSword This software generates sword blades using Compositional Pattern-Producing Networks.
An accomodating paper explores the program, outputs and effects, such as “Afterswords” (the shapes look like swords at first, then not as swords at all followed by sword-like shapes again).

####Purpose of Creation Project for UCSC CMPS265 – Generative Methods, and as a tool for generating in-game content.

####Code https://github.com/zemike/CppnSword

item.title: Project: Baraholka (board game)
item.description:
####

Baraholka (board game)

A board game about holding a booth to sell pirated videogames in the late 1990th-early 2000th in Russia.

  • Suited for 3-7 players
  • All hand-picked components are bought in Russia
  • 60 card event deck and 30 “bulk pirated videogames” (blurred on photos)
  • Hidden information and amazing events, including a Police Raid

“Baraholka” is a Russian community market.

####Purpose of Creation The final project for UCSC Analog Game class.

item.title: Project: Reap My Soul

####Reap My Soul A grim game about collecting souls of soldiers on a battlefield.

  • Cheat codes

item.title: Project: Real Money Trade in Online Videogame Market as a Primary Source of Income. (Economics paper)
item.description:
####

Real Money Trade in Online Videogame Market as a Primary Source of Income.

An economics paper that explores trade of virtual money and characters of a MMORPG in highly abstract way.

Making a model where some people can earn living by selling virtual goods, it is shown that middle class benefits from a ban of the trade and that the game degrades to pay-to-win when the videogame company is allowed to sell virtual goods for real money. Never published.

####Purpose of Creation A term-long paper for forth-year economics course Econ 490, UBC.
